Baird is Lecturer in Archaeology in the Department of History, Classics and Archaeology at Birkbeck College, University of London. Her Leverhulme-funded project, Communities on the Frontier, uses archival records and new fieldwork to examine the ancient site of Dura-Europos in Syria from its material and textual remains

Benefiel is Assistant Professor of Classics at Washington and Lee University. She is working on a study of the graffiti of Pompeii and how they contribute to ideas about civic identity and social interaction within the city and beyond

note: in particular Pompeii, where she has worked for several years.
title: Huntley is completing a PhD in the School of Archaeology and Ancient History at the University of Leicester. Her research interests include the material culture of children, religion and belief in the ancient world, and the archaeology of pre-Roman and Roman Italy

Peter Keegan is Lecturer in Ancient History at Macquarie University. His fields of research include Latin epigraphic culture, the history of gender, sexuality and the body in the Mediterranean world, late Republican and early Imperial Roman historiography and historical theory

author.particle: is a Junior Research Fellow at

note: She has published on the epigraphy and material culture of Hellenistic Afghanistan and 210 Contributors Central Asia, and has also edited Egyptian papyri and ostraca in Greek, Demotic and Coptic.
title: She was previously a Visiting Research Scholar at the Institute for the Study of the Ancient World, New York University. Her research interests centre around the interaction of Greek and non-Greek cultures in the Hellenistic eastern Mediterranean and beyond

Zadorojnyi is Lecturer in Greek Language and Literature at the University of Liverpool. His research interests include Greek historiography and biography, rhetoric, Graeco-Roman literary criticism and education, aspects of ancient intertextuality and the relationship between
